trans.tranLocal: someone who owns or manages a farm
someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
to look after someone who is ill or injured

sentences.tran: 护士会来给你打针。
sentences.tranLocal: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.

sentences.tran: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。
sentences.tranLocal: The school nurse sent Sara home.

sentences.tran: 男护士
sentences.tranLocal: a male nurse

sentences.tran: 高级护士
sentences.tranLocal: a senior nurse

sentences.tran: 实习护士
sentences.tranLocal: a student nurse (= someone who is learning to be a nurse )

sentences.tran: 精神病院护士
sentences.tranLocal: a psychiatric nurse (= a nurse for people who are mentally ill )

sentences.tran: 社区护士
sentences.tranLocal: a community nurse

trans.tranLocal: used as the plural of ‘person’ to refer to men, women, and children

sentences.tran: 有多少人到会？
sentences.tranLocal: How many people were at the meeting?

sentences.tran: 至少有40人遇害。
sentences.tranLocal: At least 40 people were killed.

sentences.tran: 住在隔壁的那些人
sentences.tranLocal: the people who live next door

phrases.tran: [口语](西方世界所谓的)上流社会人士

trans.tranLocal: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

sentences.tran: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。
sentences.tranLocal: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.

sentences.tran: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。
sentences.tranLocal: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.

sentences.tran: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.

sentences.tran: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书
sentences.tranLocal: an expensive but extremely useful book

sentences.tran: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”
sentences.tranLocal: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’

phrases.tran: [美国口语]彻底地，完全；狠狠地；有力地；毫无疑问

trans.tranLocal: small in size

sentences.tran: 小屋
sentences.tranLocal: a little house

sentences.tran: 点缀着小花的蛋糕
sentences.tranLocal: a cake decorated with little flowers

sentences.tran: 她把肉切成小丁。
sentences.tranLocal: She was cutting the meat up into little bits.

phrases.tran: 并不比…好；简直和…一样(坏)；简直就是
与…不相上于；与…几乎相同

sentences.tran: 一只六个月大的小狗

sentences.tranLocal: a seal puppy

phrases.tran: 早年初恋；少男少女间短暂的爱情（等于calf love）

sentences.tranLocal: He broke in as a football player.

sentences.tranLocal: The football player is lacking in experience.

sentences.tran: 他们都称赞他是本市最佳足球运动员。
sentences.tranLocal: They admired him as the city's best football player.

trans.tranLocal: the regular paid work that you do for an employer

sentences.tran: 你喜欢自己的工作吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Do you enjoy your job?

sentences.tran: 这是我第一份拿工资的工作。
sentences.tranLocal: It was the first paid job I ever had.

sentences.tran: 他干这份工作有六年了。
sentences.tranLocal: He’s been in the job for six years.

sentences.tran: 我在找一份新工作。
sentences.tranLocal: I’m looking for a new job.

sentences.tran: 换工作的话，会影响到你的退休金。
sentences.tranLocal: Your pension can be affected if you change jobs.
